prompt: <description>**Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. We will create a new coordinate system and then draw the required 2D sketches on two separate planes. We will scale, transform, and extrude these sketches to create the final 3D model. **Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and translation: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Draw the first 2D sketch on face 1** Next, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane in the new coordinate system, followed by four straight lines with these start and end points: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.6815, 0.0] - line_2: [0.6815, 0.0], [0.6815, 0.1645] - line_3: [0.6815, 0.1645], [0.0, 0.1645] - line_4: [0.0, 0.1645], [0.0, 0.0] **Draw the second 2D sketch on face 2** In the same coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the YZ plane, with an arc and a line: - arc_1: start point=[0.6815, 0.0]; mid point=[0.75, 0.0823]; end point=[0.6815, 0.1645] - line_1: start point=[0.6815, 0.1645]; end point=[0.6815, 0.0] **Scale and transform the 2D sketches** Scale the two sketches using a sketch_scale factor of 0.75. Then transform each sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: - euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - translation vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Extrude the 2D sketches into 3D models** Extrude the scaled and transformed sketches into 3D solids, and remove the specified depth from the original sketches: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.2873 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 The resulting part's dimensions are: - length: 0.75 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.2873 This step completes part 1 of the CAD assembly. Continue constructing subsequent parts according to the provided JSON data. Remember to always create a new coordinate system for each part and follow the instructions step by step to ensure an accurate CAD model.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Constructing the base rectangular prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, with the top being wider than the bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face and has the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.4975] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.4975], End Point [0.0, 0.4975] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4975], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.1906 towards the normal direction to create a 3D solid body. **Part 2: Constructing the cylindrical object** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1469, 0.021, 0.1906] Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face and has the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center [0.2382, 0.2382], Radius 0.2382 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4764. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.1906 towards the normal direction to create a 3D solid body. **Part 3: Constructing the cylindrical cutout** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The object has a rectangular cross-section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2303, 0.1044, 0.3811] Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face and has the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center [0.1548, 0.1548], Radius 0.1548 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3097. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.1906 towards the opposite normal direction to create a 3D solid body. Finally, combine the 3D solid bodies to create the final 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is centered and has a diameter that is approximately half the width</description>
